CVE-2020-16970 - Azure Sphere Unsigned Code Execution Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-16970
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Azure Sphere Unsigned Code Execution Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:8,1/TemporalScore:7,1
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityHigh
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionNone
ScopeChanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Azure Sphere is running on IoT devices in my environment. How do I know if any of those devices are affected by this vulnerability?

An IoT device that is running Azure Sphere and is connected to a network is automatically updated every day. This vulnerability has already been addressed so the devices are protected from this vulnerability.


This is the first time that a CVE has been issued against Azure Sphere. Why is that?

The Azure Sphere and MSRC bounty team completed a three-month security research challenge, in which we invited researchers to find and report vulnerabilities in the Azure Sphere OS. We appreciate all of the hard work of the researchers, and will be opening up several CVEs to record and reflect this work. More information on the challenge can be found here.

What version of Azure Sphere has the update that protects from this vulnerability?

All versions of Azure Sphere that are 20.07 and higher are protected from this vulnerability.

How do I ensure my Azure Sphere device has the update?

If your device is new or has not been connected to the internet for a while, connect the device to a secure, private local network with internet access and allow the device to automatically update itself. If the device is already online, verify that the operating system version 20.07 has been installed using the Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-os-version

If the device is connected to the internet and does not yet have the latest update, check the update status with the following Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-deployment-status


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is unauthorized file system access - reading from the file system.

CVE-2020-16999 - Windows WalletService Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-16999
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows WalletService Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None

 Important Elevation of Privilege

Exploitability Index

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

CVE-2020-17001 James Forshaw of Google Project Zero

CVE-2020-17004 - Windows Graphics Component Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17004
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows Graphics Component Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is the contents of Kernel memory. An attacker could read the contents of Kernel memory from a user mode process.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


 Important Information Disclosure

Exploitability Index

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

Exploitability Assessment Publicly Disclosed Exploited
Exploitation Less Likely No No

The following tables list the affected software details for the vulnerability.

CVE-2020-17019 - Microsoft Excel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact

MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Microsoft Excel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:7,8/TemporalScore:6,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionRequired
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Is the Preview Pane an attack vector for this vulnerability?

No, the Preview Pane is not an attack vector.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None

CVE-2020-17055 Yuki Chen

CVE-2020-17056 - Windows Network File System Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17056
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows Network File System Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is Kernel memory read - unintentional read access to memory contents in kernel space from a user mode process.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00

CVE-2020-17068 yangkang (@dnpushme)

CVE-2020-17069 - Windows NDIS Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17069
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows NDIS Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


 Important Information Disclosure

CVE-2020-17070 Zhiniang Peng (@edwardzpeng) and Fangming Gu (@afang5472)

CVE-2020-17071 - Windows Delivery Optimization Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17071
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows Delivery Optimization Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None

1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00

CVE-2020-17077 Zhiniang Peng (@edwardzpeng) and Fangming Gu (@afang5472)

CVE-2020-17078 - Raw Image Extension Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17078
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Raw Image Extension Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:7,8/TemporalScore:6,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionRequired
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Is Windows vulnerable in the default configuration?

No. Only customers who have installed this app from the Microsoft Store may be vulnerable.

How do I get the updated app?

The Microsoft Store will automatically update affected customers. Alternatively, customers can get the update immediately; see here for details.

It is possible for customers to disable automatic updates for the Microsoft Store. The Microsoft Store will not automatically install this update for those customers.

My system is in a disconnected environment; is it vulnerable?

Customers using the Microsoft Store for Business and Microsoft Store for Education can get this update through their organizations.

How can I check if the update is installed?

App package versions 1.0.32861.0 and later contain this update.

You can check the package version in PowerShell:

Get-AppxPackage -Name Microsoft.RawImageExtension

You can also check the package version by clicking the Start Menu > Settings > Apps > AV1 Video Extension > Advanced options


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

Exploitability Assessment Publicly Disclosed Exploited
Exploitation Less Likely No No

Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:U/RL:O/RC:C

Workarounds:
None

1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


 Critical Remote Code Execution

Exploitability Index

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

Exploitability Assessment Publicly Disclosed Exploited
Exploitation Less Likely No No

CVE-2020-17090 Noa Bratman of the Microsoft Defender for Endpoint team

CVE-2020-17091 - Microsoft Teams Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17091
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Microsoft Teams Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:7,8/TemporalScore:6,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionRequired
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

How do I know if I'm protected from this vulnerability?

Microsoft Teams Versions 1.3.00.13xxx or above are protected. If these versions are installed there is no need to take any action. If an earlier version is installed, Microsoft encourages installation of the latest available Teams version.

How can I find out what version of Teams I am running?

  1. Click on the User Avatar at the top right of the Teams Windows.
  2. Click on About, then** Version**.
  3. The version will be displayed in the banner below the Search bar.

Where do I get the latest version of Teams?

Latest version of Microsoft Teams can be downloaded at https://teams.microsoft.com/download.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:

Information published.

CVE-2020-17101 - HEIF Image Extensions Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17101
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: HEIF Image Extensions Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:7,8/TemporalScore:6,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionRequired
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

How do I get the updated app?

The Microsoft Store will automatically update affected customers. Alternatively, customers can get the update immediately; see here for details.

It is possible for customers to disable automatic updates for the Microsoft Store. The Microsoft Store will not automatically install this update for those customers.

My system is in a disconnected environment; is it vulnerable?

Customers using the Microsoft Store for Business and Microsoft Store for Education can get this update through their organizations.

How can I check if the update is installed?

App package versions 1.0.32532.0 and later contain this update.

You can check the package version in PowerShell:

Get-AppxPackage -Name Microsoft.HEIFImageExtension

You can also check the package version by clicking the Start Menu > Settings > Apps > AV1 Video Extension > Advanced options


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.

CVE-2020-17102 - WebP Image Extensions Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17102
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: WebP Image Extensions Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionRequired
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.


How do I get the updated app?

The Microsoft Store will automatically update affected customers. Alternatively, customers can get the update immediately; see here for details.

It is possible for customers to disable automatic updates for the Microsoft Store. The Microsoft Store will not automatically install this update for those customers.

My system is in a disconnected environment; is it vulnerable?

Customers using the Microsoft Store for Business and Microsoft Store for Education can get this update through their organizations.

How can I check if the update is installed?

App package versions 1.0.32731.0 and later contain this update.

You can check the package version in PowerShell:

Get-AppxPackage -Name Microsoft.WebpImageExtension

You can also check the package version by clicking the Start Menu > Settings > Apps > AV1 Video Extension > Advanced options


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.

CVE-2020-17105 - AV1 Video Extension Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17105
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: AV1 Video Extension Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:7,8/TemporalScore:6,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionRequired
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Is Windows vulnerable in the default configuration?

No. Only customers who have installed this app from the Microsoft Store may be vulnerable.

How do I get the updated app?

The Microsoft Store will automatically update affected customers. Alternatively, customers can get the update immediately; see here for details.

It is possible for customers to disable automatic updates for the Microsoft Store. The Microsoft Store will not automatically install this update for those customers.

My system is in a disconnected environment; is it vulnerable?

Customers using the Microsoft Store for Business and Microsoft Store for Education can get this update through their organizations.

How can I check if the update is installed?

App package versions 1.1.32442.0 and later contain this update.

You can check the package version in PowerShell:

Get-AppxPackage -Name Microsoft.AV1VideoExtension

You can also check the package version by clicking the Start Menu > Settings > Apps > AV1 Video Extension > Advanced options

None

CVE-2020-1599 Matt Graeber of Red Canary

CVE-2020-16981 - Azure Sphere Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-16981
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Azure Sphere Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:6,1/TemporalScore:5,3
Base score metrics
Attack VectorPhysical
Attack ComplexityHigh
Privileges RequiredHigh
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Azure Sphere is running on IoT devices in my environment. How do I know if any of those devices are affected by this vulnerability?

An IoT device that is running Azure Sphere and is connected to a network is automatically updated every day. This vulnerability has already been addressed so the devices are protected from this vulnerability.


This is the first time that a CVE has been issued against Azure Sphere. Why is that?

The Azure Sphere and MSRC bounty team completed a three-month security research challenge, in which we invited researchers to find and report vulnerabilities in the Azure Sphere OS. We appreciate all of the hard work of the researchers, and will be opening up several CVEs to record and reflect this work. More information on the challenge can be found here.

What version of Azure Sphere has the update that protects from this vulnerability?

All versions of Azure Sphere that are 20.08 and higher are protected from this vulnerability.

How do I ensure my Azure Sphere device has the update?

If your device is new or has not been connected to the internet for a while, connect the device to a secure, private local network with internet access and allow the device to automatically update itself. If the device is already online, verify that the operating system version 20.08 has been installed using the Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-os-version

If the device is connected to the internet and does not yet have the latest update, check the update status with the following Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-deployment-status


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


 Important Elevation of Privilege

Exploitability Index

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

Exploitability Assessment Publicly Disclosed Exploited
Exploitation Less Likely No No

Affected Software

The following tables list the affected software details for the vulnerability.

CVE-2020-16981
Product KB Article Severity Impact Supercedence CVSS Score Set Restart Required Known Issue

Temporal: 5,3
Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:P/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:U/RL:O/RC:C

CVE-2020-16985 - Azure Sphere Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-16985
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Azure Sphere Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:6,2/TemporalScore:5,4
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is unauthorized file system access - reading from the file system.


Azure Sphere is running on IoT devices in my environment. How do I know if any of those devices are affected by this vulnerability?

An IoT device that is running Azure Sphere and is connected to a network is automatically updated every day. This vulnerability has already been addressed so the devices are protected from this vulnerability.


This is the first time that a CVE has been issued against Azure Sphere. Why is that?

The Azure Sphere and MSRC bounty team completed a three-month security research challenge, in which we invited researchers to find and report vulnerabilities in the Azure Sphere OS. We appreciate all of the hard work of the researchers, and will be opening up several CVEs to record and reflect this work. More information on the challenge can be found here.

What version of Azure Sphere has the update that protects from this vulnerability?

All versions of Azure Sphere that are 20.09 and higher are protected from this vulnerability.

How do I ensure my Azure Sphere device has the update?

If your device is new or has not been connected to the internet for a while, connect the device to a secure, private local network with internet access and allow the device to automatically update itself. If the device is already online, verify that the operating system version 20.09 has been installed using the Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-os-version

If the device is connected to the internet and does not yet have the latest update, check the update status with the following Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-deployment-status


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


 Important Information Disclosure

Exploitability Index

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

Exploitability Assessment Publicly Disclosed Exploited
Exploitation Less Likely No No

Affected Software

Temporal: 5,4
Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N/E:U/RL:O/RC:C

CVE-2020-16986 - Azure Sphere Denial of Service Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-16986
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Azure Sphere Denial of Service Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:6,2/TemporalScore:5,4
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityNone
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Azure Sphere is running on IoT devices in my environment. How do I know if any of those devices are affected by this vulnerability?

An IoT device that is running Azure Sphere and is connected to a network is automatically updated every day. This vulnerability has already been addressed so the devices are protected from this vulnerability.


This is the first time that a CVE has been issued against Azure Sphere. Why is that?

The Azure Sphere and MSRC bounty team completed a three-month security research challenge, in which we invited researchers to find and report vulnerabilities in the Azure Sphere OS. We appreciate all of the hard work of the researchers, and will be opening up several CVEs to record and reflect this work. More information on the challenge can be found here.

What version of Azure Sphere has the update that protects from this vulnerability?

All versions of Azure Sphere that are 20.09 and higher are protected from this vulnerability.

How do I ensure my Azure Sphere device has the update?

If your device is new or has not been connected to the internet for a while, connect the device to a secure, private local network with internet access and allow the device to automatically update itself. If the device is already online, verify that the operating system version 20.09 has been installed using the Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-os-version

If the device is connected to the internet and does not yet have the latest update, check the update status with the following Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-deployment-status


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.

CVE-2020-16990 - Azure Sphere Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-16990
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Azure Sphere Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:6,2/TemporalScore:5,4
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is device information like resource ids, sas tokens, user properties, and other sensitive information.


Azure Sphere is running on IoT devices in my environment. How do I know if any of those devices are affected by this vulnerability?

An IoT device that is running Azure Sphere and is connected to a network is automatically updated every day. This vulnerability has already been addressed so the devices are protected from this vulnerability.


This is the first time that a CVE has been issued against Azure Sphere. Why is that?

The Azure Sphere and MSRC bounty team completed a three-month security research challenge, in which we invited researchers to find and report vulnerabilities in the Azure Sphere OS. We appreciate all of the hard work of the researchers, and will be opening up several CVEs to record and reflect this work. More information on the challenge can be found here.

What version of Azure Sphere has the update that protects from this vulnerability?

All versions of Azure Sphere that are 20.07 and higher are protected from this vulnerability.

How do I ensure my Azure Sphere device has the update?

If your device is new or has not been connected to the internet for a while, connect the device to a secure, private local network with internet access and allow the device to automatically update itself. If the device is already online, verify that the operating system version 20.07 has been installed using the Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-os-version

If the device is connected to the internet and does not yet have the latest update, check the update status with the following Azure Sphere CLI command:

azsphere device show-deployment-status


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.

(top)

Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is uninitialized memory and kernel memory - unintentional read access to memory contents in kernel space from a user mode process.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is unauthorized file system access - reading from the file system.

CVE-2020-17018 Pham Van Khanh @rskvp93 from Viettel Cyber Security

CVE-2020-17029 - Windows Canonical Display Driver Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17029
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows Canonical Display Driver Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00

CVE-2020-17029 Laith AL-Satari

CVE-2020-17030 - Windows MSCTF Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17030
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows MSCTF Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None

1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00

CVE-2020-17035 Walied Assar

CVE-2020-17036 - Windows Function Discovery SSDP Provider Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17036
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows Function Discovery SSDP Provider Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


 Important Information Disclosure

Exploitability Index

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

Exploitability Assessment Publicly Disclosed Exploited
Exploitation Less Likely No No

Affected Software

The following tables list the affected software details for the vulnerability.

CVE-2020-17036
Product KB Article Severity Impact Supercedence CVSS Score Set Restart Required Known Issue
Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems 4586787 (Security Update) Important Information Disclosure 4580327 Base: 5,5

CVE ID Acknowledgements
CVE-2020-17038 Guopengfei from Codesafe Team of Legendsec at Qi'anxin Group

CVE-2020-17040 - Windows Hyper-V Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17040
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows Hyper-V Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:6,5/TemporalScore:5,7
Base score metrics
Attack VectorNetwork
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityNone
IntegrityLow
AvailabilityLow
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What configurations or versions could be at risk from this vulnerability?

This bypass could affect any Hyper-V configurations that are using Router Guard.

What is the exposure if the vulnerability was bypassed?

Certain packets that would normally be blocked or dropped could be processed. This could allow an attacker to bypass set policy, potentially influencing router paths.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


1.1    11/11/2020 08:00:00    

Added FAQ to provide further vulnerability details. This is an informational change only.

Exploitability Index

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

Exploitability Assessment Publicly Disclosed Exploited
Exploitation Less Likely No No

1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


 Important Elevation of Privilege

Exploitability Index

The following table provides an exploitability assessment of each of the vulnerabilities addressed this month. The vulnerabilities are listed in order of bulletin ID then CVE ID. Only vulnerabilities that have a severity rating of Critical or Important in the bulletins are included.

Exploitability Assessment Publicly Disclosed Exploited
Exploitation Less Likely No No

CVE-2020-17044 Yuki Chen

CVE-2020-17045 - Windows KernelStream Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17045
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows KernelStream Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredLow
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What type of information could be disclosed by this vulnerability?

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None

1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00

CVE ID Acknowledgements
CVE-2020-17048 Bruno Keith (@bkth_) working with Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative

CVE-2020-17049 - Kerberos KDC Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17049
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Kerberos KDC Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:6,6/TemporalScore:5,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorNetwork
Attack ComplexityHigh
Privileges RequiredHigh
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Are there any additional steps I need to take during deployment of this update?

These steps should be followed for deployment:

  1. Locate the Kdc registry subkey, and if it exists on the system, ensure that it is set to 1.
  2. Complete the deployment to all DCs (and Read-Only DCs) in your forest.

Note that following our original guidance of using the 0 setting could cause known issues with the S4USelf feature of Kerberos. We are working to address this known issue.

If you wish to be notified when this issue has been addressed, we recommend that you register for the security notifications mailer to be alerted of the issue resolution. See Microsoft Technical Security Notifications.

Note Using Registry Editor incorrectly can cause serious problems that may require you to reinstall your operating system. Microsoft cannot guarantee that problems resulting from the incorrect use of Registry Editor can be solved. Use Registry Editor at your own risk. For information about how to edit the registry, view the "Changing Keys And Values" Help topic in Registry Editor (Regedit.exe) or view the "Add and Delete Information in the Registry" and "Edit Registry Data" Help topics in Regedt32.exe.

Registry subkey HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Kdc
Value PerformTicketSignature
Data type REG_DWORD
Data 0 – This disables ticket signatures and your domains are not protected. Important Do not use this setting until further notice. There is a known issue that could cause the S4USelf feature of Kerberos to become non-functional.
1 – The fix is enabled on the domain controller but the DC does not require that tickets conform to the fix.
2 – This enables the fix in required mode where all domains must be patched and all DCs require tickets with signatures.
Default 1 (when registry key is not set)
Reboot required? No

How does this patch affect third-party Kerberos clients?

When the registry key is set to 1, patched domain controllers will issue service tickets and Ticket-Granting Tickets (TGT)s that are not renewable and will refuse to renew existing service tickets and TGTs. Windows clients are not impacted by this since they never renew service tickets or TGTs. Third-party Kerberos clients may fail to renew service tickets or TGTs acquired from unpatched DCs. If all DCs are patched with the registry set to 1, third-party clients will no longer receive renewable tickets.

What should I do if I'm experiencing problems with my Domain Controller Servers after installing this update?

Microsoft has issued a Catalog-Only update to address a known issue. If you have applied any of the November security updates to a domain controller (DC) server and are experiencing issues, please update your DC servers with the appropriate update for your server as listed in the following table. Microsoft strongly recommends applying these catalog updates to your DCs after applying the November security updates.

Windows Version Catalog-only Update
Windows Server 2012 4594438
Windows Server 2012 R2 4594439
Windows Server 2016 4594441
Windows Server 2019 4594442
Windows Server version 1903, Windows Server version 1909 4594443
Windows Server version 2004, Windows Server version 20H2 4594440

Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None

1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


1.2    13/11/2020 08:00:00    

To address a known issue with the Kdc registry subkey settings, Microsoft has revised the guidance for deploying this update. Please see the FAQ section for updated information.


2.0    19/11/2020 08:00:00    

Added information to the FAQ regarded a non-security update to address a known issue for Domain Controllers (DC) Servers.

CVE-2020-17049 Jake Karnes of NetSPI

CVE-2020-17051 - Windows Network File System Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17051
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Windows Network File System Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:9,8/TemporalScore:8,5
Base score metrics
Attack VectorNetwork
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionNone
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

What is the attack vector for this vulnerability?

In a network-based attack an attacker with write access to an NFS share could execute code remotely within the kernel.

Is this CVE wormable?

This CVE is wormable between machines hosting writable NFS shares.

Where should the customer be applying the update?

The vulnerability only exists in Windows NFS Servers.


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.


1.1    16/11/2020 08:00:00    

Revised CVE to remove client software from the Security Updates table as this vulnerability only affects servers. Added FAQ section. These are informational changes only.

CVE ID Acknowledgements
CVE-2020-17067 Anonymous

CVE-2020-17081 - Microsoft Raw Image Extension Information Disclosure Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17081
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Microsoft Raw Image Extension Information Disclosure Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:5,5/TemporalScore:4,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionRequired
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityNone
AvailabilityNone
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Is Windows vulnerable in the default configuration?

No. Only customers who have installed this app from the Microsoft Store may be vulnerable.

How do I get the updated app?

The Microsoft Store will automatically update affected customers. Alternatively, customers can get the update immediately; see here for details.

It is possible for customers to disable automatic updates for the Microsoft Store. The Microsoft Store will not automatically install this update for those customers.

My system is in a disconnected environment; is it vulnerable?

Customers using the Microsoft Store for Business and Microsoft Store for Education can get this update through their organizations.

How can I check if the update is installed?

App package versions 1.0.32861.0 and later contain this update.

You can check the package version in PowerShell:

Get-AppxPackage -Name Microsoft.RawImageExtension

You can also check the package version by clicking the Start Menu > Settings > Apps > AV1 Video Extension > Advanced options


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.

Vector: CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N/E:U/RL:O/RC:C
 Unknown None

Acknowledgements

CVE ID Acknowledgements
CVE-2020-17081 This vulnerability was discovered by Wayne Low of Fortinet’s FortiGuard Lab

CVE-2020-17082 - Raw Image Extension Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

(top)
CVE ID Vulnerability Description Maximum Severity Rating Vulnerability Impact
CVE-2020-17082
MITRE
NVD		 CVE Title: Raw Image Extension Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
CVSS:

CVSS:3.0 Highest BaseScore:7,8/TemporalScore:6,8
Base score metrics
Attack VectorLocal
Attack ComplexityLow
Privileges RequiredNone
User InteractionRequired
ScopeUnchanged
ConfidentialityHigh
IntegrityHigh
AvailabilityHigh
Temporal score metrics
Exploit Code MaturityUnproven
Remediation LevelOfficial Fix
Report ConfidenceConfirmed

FAQ:

Is Windows vulnerable in the default configuration?

No. Only customers who have installed this app from the Microsoft Store may be vulnerable.

How do I get the updated app?

The Microsoft Store will automatically update affected customers. Alternatively, customers can get the update immediately; see here for details.

It is possible for customers to disable automatic updates for the Microsoft Store. The Microsoft Store will not automatically install this update for those customers.

My system is in a disconnected environment; is it vulnerable?

Customers using the Microsoft Store for Business and Microsoft Store for Education can get this update through their organizations.

How can I check if the update is installed?

App package versions 1.0.32861.0 and later contain this update.

You can check the package version in PowerShell:

Get-AppxPackage -Name Microsoft.RawImageExtension

You can also check the package version by clicking the Start Menu > Settings > Apps > AV1 Video Extension > Advanced options


Mitigations:
None
Workarounds:
None
Revision:
1.0    10/11/2020 08:00:00    

Information published.
